channel.title: Wack Pack Stories
channel.itunes:author: Optimus Prime
channel.description:
Journey into the wild and wonderful world of the Howard Stern Show's most colorful characters through Wack Pack Stories. This captivating series delves deep into the unforgettable moments, legendary personalities, and outrageous encounters that have made the Wack Pack a cultural phenomenon. Each episode uncovers the fascinating stories behind these unique individuals who have become an integral part of radio history.
From their first appearances to their most memorable interactions, Wack Pack Stories chronicles the authentic, unfiltered, and often hilarious experiences that have entertained millions of listeners. Through carefully curated archives and insider perspectives, this podcast preserves and celebrates the legacy of these distinctive personalities who have helped shape the landscape of entertainment radio.
Disclaimer: This podcast contains adult content and language. All content related to the Howard Stern Show and its personalities is presented for entertainment purposes. This description is experimental and was generated by artificial intelligence.
channel.itunes:summary: Explores memorable characters and outrageous moments from Howard Stern Show Wack Pack history through archived recordings.

itunes:category.text: Comedy > Comedy Interviews, Entertainment > TV & Film, Society & Culture > Personal Journals

item.title: Death Threats and Restraining Orders: The High Pitch vs Elephant Boy Saga
item.itunes:title: Death Threats and Restraining Orders: The High Pitch vs Elephant Boy Saga
item.description:
Dive into one of the most explosive confrontations in Howard Stern Show history as Wack Pack Stories examines the infamous 2016 feud between High Pitch Erik and Fred the Elephant Boy. This episode unravels the dramatic escalation from harmless text messages to a full-blown criminal case that required NYPD intervention. Experience the shocking moment when High Pitch Erik's threatening messages led to his arrest in Queens and the unprecedented legal drama that followed, culminating in a New York City judge issuing a restraining order between two Wack Pack members. The narrative captures the intense rivalry's evolution, from its dangerous peak to an awkward on-air reconciliation that perfectly embodied the unique dynamics of the Stern Show universe. The episode takes on added poignancy with a tribute to Fred the Elephant Boy, the longest-serving Wack Pack member, whose recent passing from blood clot complications marked the end of an era. This compelling chapter in Wack Pack history showcases how the line between entertainment and reality often blurred in the most unexpected ways.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again - Book" (https://amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "The Howard Stern Show: The Wack Pack Documentary" (https://www.howardstern.com/show/2019/3/11/howard-stern-presents-wack-history-month-documentary) • "Fred the Elephant Boy Obituary" (https://www.newsday.com/obituaries/fred-schreiber-elephant-boy-howard-stern-dead) • "The History of the Wack Pack - Article" (https://www.rollingstone.com/tv-movies/tv-movie-features/howard-stern-wack-pack-history)

item.title: From Enemies to Brothers: The Joey Boots and High Pitch Erik Story
item.itunes:title: From Enemies to Brothers: The Joey Boots and High Pitch Erik Story
item.description:
Delve into one of the Howard Stern Show's most compelling Wack Pack friendships in this poignant episode of Wack Pack Stories. The unlikely bond between High Pitch Erik, known for his distinctive vocal range and celebrity fixations, and Joey Boots, the legendary "Baba Booey" heckler, takes center stage as we explore their unique relationship that flourished in a New York City apartment building. From their memorable on-air squabbles to genuine moments of friendship, the episode chronicles how these two larger-than-life personalities became inseparable despite their differences. The story takes an emotional turn as it recounts the tragic events of December 23, 2016, when High Pitch Erik discovered Joey Boots had passed away at age 49. Through candid interviews and classic Stern Show moments, this episode reveals the authentic human connection that developed between two of the most colorful characters in Wack Pack history, proving that genuine friendship can emerge from the most unexpected places. Their story transcends the usual chaos of the Howard Stern Show, offering a touching testament to the power of unconditional friendship.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "The History of Howard Stern" (https://www.siriusxm.com/howard-stern-history) • "Remembering Joey Boots: A Wack Pack Legend" (https://www.howardstern.com/news/joey-boots-tribute) • "The Wack Pack: An Oral History" - Article (https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/stern-show-wack-pack)

item.title: When Beetlejuice Met High Pitch: The Roast Battle That Shook The Stern Show
item.itunes:title: When Beetlejuice Met High Pitch: The Roast Battle That Shook The Stern Show
item.description:
Dive into one of the most unforgettable moments in Howard Stern Show history as Wack Pack Stories presents the epic 2024 roast battle between Beetlejuice and High Pitch Erik. After a five-year hiatus, Beetlejuice's return to the studio unexpectedly evolved into a no-holds-barred comedy showdown when High Pitch Erik, riding high on his Cameo roasting success, threw down the gauntlet. What ensued was twelve minutes of unscripted entertainment that would become legendary in Stern Show lore. Under the attempted guidance of seasoned roast master Sal Governale, both Wack Packers delivered an array of zingers, from Erik's "hang glide on a Dorito" jab to Beetle's now-iconic "Taco Bell Mexican phone company" retort. The impromptu battle showcased the raw, unfiltered chemistry that made the Wack Pack a cornerstone of Stern Show entertainment, with Beetlejuice proving why he earned his title as the King of the Wack Pack. This episode captures the essence of what makes these unscripted moments so special, demonstrating how sometimes the best comedy comes from the most unexpected sources.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again - Book" (https://amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "Private Parts - Movie" (https://amazon.com/Howard-Sterns-Private-Parts/dp/B000I9VOGC) • "The History of the Wack Pack" (https://www.howardstern.com/show/2019/03/25/history-wack-pack) • "Beetlejuice: This Is My Life Now - Documentary" (https://amazon.com/Beetlejuice-This-Life-Sean-Dunne/dp/B08N5MSQS7)

item.title: Beetlejuice: He Made His Own Reality
item.itunes:title: Beetlejuice: He Made His Own Reality
item.description:
Step into the surreal world of Howard Stern's most beloved Wack Packer in this captivating episode of Wack Pack Stories, dedicated to the incomparable Beetlejuice. From his unforgettable 1999 debut to his recent collaborations with hip-hop royalty, Lester "Beetlejuice" Green has crafted an unparalleled legacy of quotable moments that continue to entertain and mystify audiences worldwide. This episode delves deep into Beet's most memorable utterances, from his creative height claims ("six foot five") to his innovative approach to spelling ("L-S-T-E-R... RED"). We explore his unique perspective on everything from career choices to culinary preferences, showcasing why he remains one of the most endearing figures in the Stern Show universe. The episode highlights his recent renaissance, including his venture into cryptocurrency with BeetCoin and his groundbreaking musical collaboration with Snoop Dogg and Sean Paul in 2025. Through his fantastical claims of earning "ten million dollars every five minutes" to his philosophical musings, Beetlejuice's quotable moments have transcended mere entertainment to become part of pop culture history, proving why he's remained a fan favorite for over two decades.
Further Reading: • 'Howard Stern's Wack Pack: An Oral History - Book' (https://amazon.com/books/howard-stern-wack-pack-oral-history) • 'Private Parts - Movie' (https://primevideo.com/private-parts) • 'The Evolution of Beetlejuice: From Howard Stern Show to Social Media Stardom' (https://rollingstone.com/beetlejuice-evolution) • 'Beetle's World: The Unauthorized Biography - Book' (https://amazon.com/books/beetles-world) • 'The Howard Stern Show: The Wack Pack Years - Documentary' (https://primevideo.com/stern-show-wack-pack)

item.title: Love in the Wack Pack: Bigfoot Says I Do
item.itunes:title: Love in the Wack Pack: Bigfoot Says I Do
item.description:
Dive into the unconventional world of romance in this captivating episode of Wack Pack Stories, exploring the fascinating love lives of Howard Stern's most memorable characters. From Bigfoot's surprising marriage announcement to High Pitch Erik's celebrity infatuations, this episode unravels the complex tapestry of relationships within the Wack Pack universe. The narrative centers on Bigfoot's unexpected journey to matrimony, as the Vermont native finds someone who embraces his unique personality and distinctive voice. The episode also pays tribute to the late Fred the Elephant Boy's touching quest for companionship, highlighting his memorable personal ads and candid discussions about loneliness with Howard. Through Mark the Bagger's upcoming memoir revelations and Beetlejuice's colorful dating history, listeners gain intimate insight into how love manifests within this extraordinary group. This compelling exploration of Wack Pack romance reveals that beneath the surface of their eccentric personas lies a very human desire for connection and acceptance, proving that love truly knows no bounds in the Stern Show universe.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "Private Parts" - Movie (https://www.amazon.com/Private-Parts-Howard-Stern/dp/B000GUL9VM) • "The History of Howard Stern" (https://www.siriusxm.com/howard100) • "The Wack Pack: An Oral History" (https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/culture-features/howard-stern-wack-pack-history) • "Miss America" - Book (https://amazon.com/Miss-America-Howard-Stern/dp/0060391677)

item.title: Eric the Actor: From American Idol Rage to Radio Legend
item.itunes:title: Eric the Actor: From American Idol Rage to Radio Legend
item.description:
In this landmark episode of Wack Pack Stories, we revisit September 19, 2002, when Eric Lynch - forever known as Eric the Actor - made his unforgettable debut on The Howard Stern Show. What began with an angry defense of American Idol winner Kelly Clarkson evolved into one of the most legendary caller relationships in radio history. Standing at just three feet tall and living with Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, Eric's distinctive high-pitched voice and unwavering defiance against Howard's antics quickly made him a standout personality. His steadfast refusal to embrace the "Wack Pack" label, fierce protection of his preferred name "Eric the Actor," and unfiltered interactions with the show's cast created countless memorable moments over his twelve-year run. From his passionate defense of celebrities to his infamous threats against Fred Norris, Eric's authenticity and uncompromising nature endeared him to millions of listeners. His daily calls became must-listen radio, showcasing a complex personality that transcended his physical limitations. Until his passing in 2014, Eric remained true to his convictions, earning him recognition from Rolling Stone as "the greatest Wack Packer of all time" and cementing his legacy as one of the most beloved figures in Stern Show history.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "The History of Howard Stern" (https://www.siriusxm.com/howard100) • "Remembering Eric the Actor" (https://www.rollingstone.com/tv-movies/tv-movie-news/howard-stern-wack-packer-eric-the-actor-dead-at-39-177599/) • "Eric the Actor: A Life in Radio" - Documentary (https://www.amazon.com/Eric-Actor-Life-Radio/dp/B07N8XK9YZ)

item.title: Howard's Channel 9 Revolution: The Secaucus Experiment
item.itunes:title: Howard's Channel 9 Revolution: The Secaucus Experiment
item.description:
Dive into a pivotal moment in television history as Wack Pack Stories explores the groundbreaking Channel 9 show that launched Howard Stern's visual empire. From 1990 to 1992, a modest studio in Secaucus, New Jersey became the epicenter of late-night television revolution, delivering 69 episodes of unfiltered, unscripted chaos that would reshape entertainment forever. This episode uncovers the show's tumultuous origins, including the network's initial resistance to live broadcasting and Howard's unwavering ultimatum. Experience the raw energy of early Wack Pack personalities like Fred the Elephant Boy, Kenneth Keith Kallenbach, and Crackhead Bob as they made their unforgettable television debuts. Learn how this groundbreaking series managed to outperform Johnny Carson in the New York market despite its public access roots, and discover the real story behind its eventual cancellation. Through firsthand accounts and behind-the-scenes revelations, this episode illuminates how The Howard Stern Show on Channel 9 laid the foundation for modern reality TV and shock comedy, creating a legacy that continues to influence entertainment today.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern: King of All Media - Book" (https://amazon.com/dp/0312961944) • "The History of Howard Stern - Documentary" (https://amazon.com/dp/B001NXBRGO) • "The Rise of Reality TV: From Public Access to Pop Culture" (https://www.rollingstone.com/tv-movies/tv-movie-features/history-reality-tv-howard-stern-jersey-shore-1234567890) • "The Wack Pack: An Oral History" (https://www.vulture.com/article/wack-pack-history-howard-stern.html)

item.title: Beetlejuice: 4'3" Giant Who Conquered Howard Stern
item.itunes:title: Beetlejuice: 4'3" Giant Who Conquered Howard Stern
item.description:
Step into the fascinating world of Howard Stern Show history as Wack Pack Stories chronicles the legendary first appearance of Beetlejuice, one of radio's most memorable personalities. On July 14, 1999, Lester Green, accompanied by Frank Third Degree Burns and Sean Rooney, walked into K-Rock studios and instantly became a cultural phenomenon. This pivotal episode explores how a 5-foot-tall dynamo with an infectious laugh and unshakeable confidence transformed from an unknown guest into the show's most iconic Wack Packer. Through detailed storytelling and original audio, listeners will experience the electric atmosphere of that summer morning when Howard Stern immediately recognized he had discovered someone extraordinary. The episode traces Beetlejuice's evolution from his unforgettable debut through his countless memorable appearances, wrestling adventures, and celebrity encounters, culminating in his triumphant 2021 return after a five-year hiatus. Witness the beginning of what would become a two-decade legacy of unfiltered entertainment, as Wack Pack Stories reveals how Beetlejuice's natural charisma and unpredictable wit made him, in Howard's words, a "once in a lifetime guest" who would go on to appear hundreds of times and remain the greatest character in the show's storied history.
Further Reading: • 'Howard Stern Comes Again - Book' (https://amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • 'The History of Howard Stern - Documentary' (https://amazon.com/History-Howard-Stern/dp/B000VWEFP8) • 'The Wack Pack: An Oral History' (https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/culture-features/wack-pack-oral-history-howard-stern-show-967663/) • 'Beetlejuice: The Big Man - Documentary' (https://amazon.com/Beetlejuice-Big-Man/dp/B08F7Z9XK4)

item.title: Crackhead Bob: From Tipa Tipa to Radio Legend
item.itunes:title: Crackhead Bob: From Tipa Tipa to Radio Legend
item.description:
In this poignant episode of Wack Pack Stories, we explore the unforgettable debut of one of The Howard Stern Show's most beloved characters - Crackhead Bob. On November 7, 1995, a seemingly ordinary call transformed into a defining moment of radio history when George Harvey, struggling with his distinctive speech impediment, first uttered his now-legendary phrase "tipa tipa tuggy." The episode delves deep into how a former crack cocaine user's darkest struggles became an unexpected source of entertainment and inspiration. Through detailed accounts of Bob's first interaction with Howard and the crew, listeners discover how his unwavering positivity and willingness to embrace his condition made him an instant hit. The story traces Bob's evolution from an anonymous caller to a Wack Pack legend, highlighting his memorable catchphrases, unforgettable appearances, and the genuine warmth he brought to the show. Despite the humorous nature of his contributions, the episode thoughtfully balances entertainment with the sobering reality of addiction's lasting effects, culminating in a touching tribute to Bob's legacy following his untimely passing in 2016. This compelling narrative serves as both a celebration of Crackhead Bob's impact on The Howard Stern Show and a reminder of his enduring message about finding humor and hope in life's challenges.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "The History of Howard Stern" - Documentary Series (https://primevideo.com/howard-stern-history) • "Remembering Wack Packer Crackhead Bob" (https://www.howardstern.com/news/2016/2/1/remembering-wack-packer-crackhead-bob/) • "The Wack Pack: An Oral History" (https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/culture-features/howard-stern-wack-pack-oral-history/)

Despite the humorous nature of his contributions, the episode thoughtfully balances entertainment with the sobering reality of addiction's lasting effects, culminating in a touching tribute to Bob's legacy following his untimely passing in 2016. This compelling narrative serves as both a celebration of Crackhead Bob's impact on The Howard Stern Show and a reminder of his enduring message about finding humor and hope in life's challenges.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "The History of Howard Stern" - Documentary Series (https://primevideo.com/howard-stern-history) • "Remembering Wack Packer Crackhead Bob" (https://www.howardstern.com/news/2016/2/1/remembering-wack-packer-crackhead-bob/) • "The Wack Pack: An Oral History" (https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/culture-features/howard-stern-wack-pack-oral-history/)

item.title: Benjy's Late Game: The Chronic Tardiness That Almost Killed His Career
item.itunes:title: Benjy's Late Game: The Chronic Tardiness That Almost Killed His Career
item.description:
Dive into one of the Howard Stern Show's most notorious running storylines in this revealing episode of Wack Pack Stories exploring the saga of Benjy Bronk's legendary tardiness. From 2010 to 2016, Benjy's chronic lateness evolved from a minor annoyance into a major source of on-air drama, culminating in his infamous banishment from the studio. This episode examines how a brilliant comedy writer whose real-time contributions helped shape Howard's signature style found himself repeatedly at odds with the clock, leading to multiple suspensions and ultimatums. Through archival clips and behind-the-scenes details, we unpack the complex dynamic between Howard's demand for professionalism and Benjy's seemingly inability to arrive on time, despite his valued role as a key creative force. The story serves as a perfect microcosm of the Stern Show's unique workplace culture, where talent and turbulence often intersect, and even the most frustrating situations somehow transform into compelling radio entertainment. Despite the professional consequences, Benjy's enduring presence on the show highlights a deeper truth about the Stern Show family - that sometimes the most challenging relationships produce the most memorable moments.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "Getting Late with Benjy Bronk" (https://www.marksfriggin.com/news16/10-24.htm) • "The History of Howard Stern" - Documentary Series (https://www.amazon.com/History-Howard-Stern/dp/B000VWYJ5Y) • "Private Parts" - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Private-Parts-Howard-Stern/dp/0671009443)

item.title: High Pitch Eric's Ring Pop Romance: Kelly Clarkson Obsession
item.itunes:title: High Pitch Eric's Ring Pop Romance: Kelly Clarkson Obsession
item.description:
Delve into one of the Howard Stern Show's most infamous obsessions as Wack Pack Stories examines High Pitch Eric's unsettling fixation with Kelly Clarkson. This episode unravels the bizarre saga that began in 2006 when Eric's celebrity crush spiraled into concerning behavior that would span nearly two decades. From daily call-ins and shrine building to an unforgettable studio encounter with a Kelly Clarkson impersonator, witness the moment that cemented this story in Stern Show history. The narrative takes listeners through Eric's memorable on-air proposal with a Ring Pop, complete with Fred's iconic sound drops and studio chaos. Fast forward to 2025, and the story takes a darker turn, revealing how what started as classic Wack Pack entertainment evolved into serious legal consequences, including restraining orders and banned studio access. This compelling installment of Wack Pack Stories serves as both a time capsule of classic Stern Show moments and a cautionary tale about when fandom crosses concerning boundaries, offering an unprecedented look into one of the most peculiar chapters in Wack Pack lore.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "Kelly Clarkson: From American Idol to Talk Show Host" (https://www.rollingstone.com/kelly-clarkson-profile) • "The Wack Pack: An Oral History" (https://www.vulture.com/article/howard-stern-wack-pack-oral-history.html) • "Celebrity Stalking: When Fandom Goes Too Far" - Documentary (https://primevideo.com/celebrity-stalking-documentary)

item.title: Baba Booey's 30,000 Pieces of Vinyl: A Stern Show Legacy
item.itunes:title: Baba Booey's 30,000 Pieces of Vinyl: A Stern Show Legacy
item.description:
In this revealing episode of Wack Pack Stories, we delve into the fascinating evolution of Gary Dell'Abate's legendary vinyl collection, from its iconic beginnings with "thirty thousand pieces of vinyl" to its unexpected downsizing. The episode explores how Gary's famous 1996 proclamation became a cornerstone of Stern Show lore, leading to the creation of his temperature-controlled vault in Connecticut. We uncover the surprising connection between Gary's recent Ozempic journey and his decision to dramatically reduce his collection in 2021. The story takes an intriguing turn as we examine how the weight loss medication potentially influenced his relationship with vinyl collecting, transforming a decades-long obsession into a more curated appreciation. From the meticulous "Booey Decimal System" to his endearing mispronunciation of "voinyl," this episode captures the essence of how personal passions evolve over time, while maintaining the humor and heart that Wack Pack Stories fans have come to love. The narrative weaves together Gary's vinyl journey with his recent lifestyle changes, offering a unique perspective on how our relationships with our collections can change while core personality traits remain charmingly constant.
Further Reading: • 'Life of Howard Stern: Remarkable Story Behind the King of All Media - Book' (https://amazon.com/dp/1501191993) • 'They Call Me Baba Booey - Book' (https://amazon.com/dp/0812981898) • 'The History of Vinyl Records' (https://www.smithsonianmag.com/arts-culture/the-history-of-the-vinyl-record-147845619/) • 'Record Store Day: Inside the Vinyl Revival' (https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-features/record-store-day-vinyl-revival) • 'The Stern Show: A Visual History - Book' (https://amazon.com/dp/1501191985)
